medical_history.chief_complaint: Left subcostal pain and subsequent symptoms indicating complications from early gastric cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with left subcostal pain. After six weeks, she returned with anorexia, weight loss, and abdominal bloating. Gas-troscopy revealed mucosal hyperemia, and multiple biopsies were histologically normal. A second examination showed hyperemia without focal lesions. Eventually, laparotomy and biopsy confirmed metastatic signet-ring-cell carcinoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Family history of gastric cancer; the proband's mother and maternal grandmother both died of metastatic gastric cancer at young ages.
medical_history.family_history: Proband's mother died of gastric cancer at age 29, presented first with vague dyspeptic symptoms. Maternal grandmother died of gastric cancer at age 32. Great-grandfather died of gastric cancer at age 43. All closely related individuals had similar conditions, indicating a familial predisposition to gastric cancer.
